intro: Premna subscandens var. minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered premna, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a slightly hairy surface. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
